co.hoomi

Class HoomiClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.hoomi.HoomiClient

  • public class HoomiClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The main entry point for working with Hoomi.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HoomiClient(Context context, java.lang.String applicationId)
      Creates a HoomiClient with the given application ID from Hoomi.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Begins the process of authorizing with Hoomi using the given redirect URL and scopes.
      bolts.Task<AppData> getAppDataAsync()
      Gets the app data for the current user (the current token must have the user:app:data:read scope).

      Gets the app data for a user.

      Gets the current HoomiClient.

      Gets the current access token for this Hoomi client.

      Gets token information for the given Hoomi access token.

      Gets the Web Google Client ID used for client authentication.

      Clears the current access token.

      Sets the app data for the user with the given token.

      Sets the app data for the user with the given token.

        Creates a HoomiClient with the given application ID from Hoomi.
        Parameters:
        context - an Android context
        applicationId - the application ID that this client will use

      • authorizeAsync

        public bolts.Task<HoomiAccessToken> authorizeAsync(Uri redirectUri,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> scopes)
        Begins the process of authorizing with Hoomi using the given redirect URL and scopes.
        Parameters:
        redirectUri - the redirect URL to use to return to your app
        scopes - the set of scopes to request access to
        Returns:
        a HoomiAccessToken (asynchronously)

      • getTokenInformationAsync

        public bolts.Task<TokenInformation> getTokenInformationAsync(HoomiAccessToken token)
        Gets token information for the given Hoomi access token.
        Parameters:
        token - the token to fetch information for
        Returns:
        TokenInformation (asynchronously)

      • getAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> getAppDataAsync()
        Gets the app data for the current user (the current token must have the user:app:data:read scope).
        Returns:
        AppData (asynchronously)

      • getAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> getAppDataAsync(HoomiAccessToken token)
        Gets the app data for a user.
        Parameters:
        token - the access token (which must have the user:app:data:read scope) for the user
        Returns:
        AppData (asynchronously)

      • setAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> setAppDataAsync(JSONObject json)
        Sets the app data for the current user (the current token must have the user:app:data:write scope).
        Parameters:
        json - the new data to associate with the user
        Returns:
        the new AppData (asynchronously)

      • setAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> setAppDataAsync(JSONObject json,
                                           java.lang.String eTag)
        Sets the app data for the current user (the current token must have the user:app:data:write scope)
        Parameters:
        json - the new data to associate with the user
        eTag - an ETag to be used for optimistic concurrency control. Set to "*" to ignore the ETag.
        Returns:
        the new AppData (asynchronously)

      • setAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> setAppDataAsync(HoomiAccessToken token,
                                           JSONObject json)
        Sets the app data for the user with the given token.
        Parameters:
        token - the access token (which must have the user:app:data:write scope) for the user
        json - the new data to associate with the user
        Returns:
        the new AppData (asynchronously)

      • setAppDataAsync

        public bolts.Task<AppData> setAppDataAsync(HoomiAccessToken token,
                                           JSONObject json,
                                           java.lang.String eTag)
        Sets the app data for the user with the given token.
        Parameters:
        token - the access token (which must have the user:app:data:write scope) for the user
        json - the new data to associate with the user
        eTag - an ETag to be used for optimistic concurrency control. Set to "*" to ignore the ETag.
        Returns:
        thew new AppData (asynchronously)

      • getCurrentToken

        public HoomiAccessToken getCurrentToken()
        Gets the current access token for this Hoomi client. This value is automatically set after authorization completes and is cached locally between runs of the application.
        Returns:
        the current HoomiAccessToken

      • setCurrentToken

        public void setCurrentToken(HoomiAccessToken token)
        Sets the current access token for this Hoomi client. This value is automatically set after authorization completes and is cached locally between runs of the application.
        Parameters:
        token - the new current token

      • logOut

        public void logOut()
        Clears the current access token.

      • getCurrentClient

        public static HoomiClient getCurrentClient()
        Gets the current HoomiClient. This value is automatically initialized with the first client you create.
        Returns:
        the current HoomiClient

      • setCurrentClient

        public static void setCurrentClient(HoomiClient client)
        Sets the current HoomiClient. This value is automatically initialized with the first client you create.
        Parameters:
        client - the new current HoomiClient
